IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To provide funding, oversight, technical assistance, and guidance to nonprofit, community based organizations and other tax exempt agencies which serve the populations of eastern Riverside County in the areas of health, mental health, and juvenile intervention.
IRS990.MissionDescription: To provide funding, oversight, technical assistance, and guidance to nonprofit, community based organizations and other tax exempt agencies which serve the populations of eastern Riverside County in the areas of health, mental health, and juvenile intervention.
IRS990.Description: To provide funding and free technical assistance to tax exempt organizations that provide health, mental health, and juvenile intervention services to residents of eastern Riverside County

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Recipient organizations are required to submit financial and programaticreports on a monthly,quarterly and annual basis.Site visits to the recipient organizations are performed on as needed basis.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Because we are required to meet the Brown Act regarding open meetings and providing the public with information we post all agendas and meeting notices in out building, with Riverside County and on our website. Minutes are available as well and an annual report is developed. Information regarding funding is available on our website and we also utilize PSA's to notify the public regarding funding, training, educational seminars, etc.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: As part of the budget and staff review processes, the Board of Directors is provided with current wage and salary studies appropriate to the area; and any cost of living information available. Because of our geographic size, there are no studies currently available for the Coachella Valley so we utilize information available for Riverside and San Bernardino Counties. The studies utilized are purchased from GuideStar and obtained from the Council on Foundations. Initially the CEO meets with a budget committee to review options and make recommendations, however, the entire Board of Directors is provided with all materials prior to any decisions regarding salaries

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board Members go through an orientation process that makes clear their legal requirements for conflict of interest. In addition, the issue is discussed prior to any vote that impacts the foundation. Each year at the annual corporate meeting, conflict of interest policy is restated. In the event of a conflict, the member in question is excused from the meeting until the conflict has been discussed and action is taken by the other Board members.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors audit committee and CEO meet with the CPA, who is the independent preparer for form 990, to review any form 990 issues. After approval from the audit committee, the 990 is presented to the entire Board of Directors for review. After approval by all Board members, the independent preparer electronically files form 990.
